</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Program Flow </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Assign a user friendly name to the [[Script_(Handle)|VM script]] this command is executed from.

Once name is assigned, it cannot be changed. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''scriptName''' name </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> name: [[String]] -  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[scriptName]] [[format]] ["%1ARTY\data\scripts\ARTY_sadarmDeploy.sqf (_this: %1)",_this];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 17:39, 13 June 2009 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Vigilante|Vigilante]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
[[scriptName]] is good when you want to load the handle of some spawn or call with some name:<br>
<code>example_scripthandle = [] [[spawn]] {
    [[scriptName]] "Example";
    [[systemChat]] [[str]] example_scripthandle; // System: Example
}</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
